comments:
This has been working through 3.1 M1, but causes an error in stable M3 (build
200411050810)

Seems to load all other image formats correctly, but not a single windows ICO file.

Problematic source and exception below.  Looks like the WinICOFileFormat
implementation is the culprit, although I didn't dig too deep - I'm not familiar
with the ICO format.

Thanks,

- John




************ PROBLEM SOURCE **************************


import org.eclipse.swt.graphics.ImageData;
import org.eclipse.swt.graphics.ImageLoader;

public class IcoBug {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		 
		 String icoFile = "test.ico";
		 
		 ImageLoader loader = new ImageLoader();
		 ImageData[] data = loader.load(icoFile);
		 
	}
}


************ EXCEPTION **************************

java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
	at java.lang.System.arraycopy(Native Method)
	at
org.eclipse.swt.internal.image.WinICOFileFormat.convertPad(WinICOFileFormat.java:28)
	at
org.eclipse.swt.internal.image.WinICOFileFormat.loadIcon(WinICOFileFormat.java:130)
	at
org.eclipse.swt.internal.image.WinICOFileFormat.loadFromByteStream(WinICOFileFormat.java:111)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.image.FileFormat.loadFromStream(FileFormat.java:47)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.image.FileFormat.load(FileFormat.java:75)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.ImageLoader.load(ImageLoader.java:125)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.ImageLoader.load(ImageLoader.java:152)
	at IcoBug.main(IcoBug.java:17)
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 78226 ***
